etymologies: mid 16th century: from French jasmin and obsolete French jessemin, from Arabic yāsamīn, from Persian yāsamīn

definitions: an Old World shrub or climbing plant that bears fragrant flowers used in perfumery or tea. It is popular as an ornamental.

notes.text: Genus Jasminum, family Oleaceae: many species, including the winter jasmine

shortDefinitions: Old World shrub or climbing plant which is popular as ornamental

definitions: used in names of other shrubs or climbers with fragrant flowers, e.g. Cape jasmine, yellow jasmine.
shortDefinitions: used in names of other shrubs or climbers with fragrant flowers
